Create lags or leads of a matrix

Source: R/prediction_intervals.R
leadlagMat.Rd

This is a wrapper for the function conformalForecast::lagmatrix.Find a shifted version of a matrix, adjusting the time base backward (lagged) or forward (leading) by a specified number of observations for each column.

Usage

leadlagMat(x, lag)

Arguments

x

A matrix or multivariate time series.

lag

A vector of lags (positive values) or leads (negative values) with a length equal to the number of columns of x.

Value

A matrix with the same class and size as x.

Examples

x <- matrix(rnorm(20), nrow = 5, ncol = 4)

# Create lags of a matrix
leadlagMat(x, c(0, 1, 2, 3))
#>             [,1]       [,2]       [,3]      [,4]
#> [1,]  0.25331851         NA         NA        NA
#> [2,] -0.02854676  1.5164706         NA        NA
#> [3,] -0.04287046 -1.5487528  0.3796395        NA
#> [4,]  1.36860228  0.5846137 -0.5023235 0.3035286
#> [5,] -0.22577099  0.1238542 -0.3332074 0.4482098
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "matrix" "array" 

# Create leads of a matrix
leadlagMat(x, c(0, -1, -2, -3))
#>             [,1]       [,2]       [,3]      [,4]
#> [1,]  0.25331851 -1.5487528 -0.3332074 0.9222675
#> [2,] -0.02854676  0.5846137 -1.0185754 2.0500847
#> [3,] -0.04287046  0.1238542 -1.0717912        NA
#> [4,]  1.36860228  0.2159416         NA        NA
#> [5,] -0.22577099         NA         NA        NA
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "matrix" "array"
